meanings.definition: Unable to move or feel all or part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The injured man was paralysed from the waist down after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked paralysed with fear when it saw the big dog.
meanings.sent3: The idea of giving a speech in front of the whole school left him feeling paralysed.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed to cast a paralysed shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The icy water was so cold that it left his fingers paralysed with numbness.

meanings.definition: To make someone unable to move or feel all or part of their body.
meanings.sent1: The snake's venom can paralyse its prey, making it easier to catch.
meanings.sent2: The spider's bite paralysed the insect almost instantly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to paralyse the audience with amazement.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise from the explosion seemed to paralyse time itself for a moment.
meanings.sent5: The sudden realization of the danger ahead paralysed him with fear.
